RECORD.TEXT: 279117013 WGH 5658007 343705 9758330 2/25/2005 12:00:00 AM Discharge Summary Signed DIS Report Status : Signed DISCHARGE SUMMARY NAME : JESCBLAGLEEBHAWNJO , NICK R UNIT NUMBER : 199-62-31 ADMISSION DATE : 02/25/2005 DISCHARGE DATE : 02/27/2005 PRIMARY DIAGNOSIS : Renal cell carcinoma . ASSOCIATED DIAGNOSES : Hypertension , prior cerebral aneurysm surgery , prior cholecystectomy . PRIMARY PROCEDURE : Left partial nephrectomy . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : This patient is a 56-year-old woman with left renal cancer . This was initially diagnosed as an incidental finding during an admission in 10/2004 for acute cholecystitis . She underwent laparoscopic cholecystectomy at that time . Her CT scan showed an incidental finding in the left kidney and she was referred for further evaluation . The cytology was obtained in with atypical transitional cells with degenerative changes in the urine . The patient was referred on for evaluation of her renal mass . The renal mass was biopsied and was positive for renal cell carcinoma . A chest CT was done for staging showing only stable old granulomatous disease . The patient was referred to Dr. Gardner for a surgical treatment . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Hypertension , osteoarthritis of the knee , restless leg syndrome . PAST SURGICAL HISTORY : Appendectomy , tonsillectomy , left ankle subtalar fusion , clipping of anterior parietal artery aneurysm , laparoscopic cholecystectomy . MEDICATIONS ON PRESENTATION : Zestril 10 mg p.o. daily , Mirapex 0.25 mg p.o. q.h.s. , Celexa 10 mg p.o. q.h.s. and Zantac 150 mg p.o. b.i.d. PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : On physical examination in Dr. Gardner 's clinic , the patient was afebrile and mildly hypertensive . Her physical exam was unremarkable . No abdominal masses were appreciated . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was brought to the operating room on 2/25/2005 where a left open partial nephrectomy was carried out under general endotracheal anesthesia . The intraoperative margins were negative . For full account of this procedure please see the separately dictated operative report . In brief , the patient tolerated the procedure well , was extubated in the operating room without perioperative complication . After a short stay in the recovery room , she was transferred to regular floor bed on the evening of the operation . That evening she had no complaints . She was afebrile , her vital signs were stable and her urine output was adequate . The drainage in her Jackson-Pratt drain was minimal and serosanguineous . Her lungs are clear . Her heart was irregular . Her abdomen was soft and her Jackson-Pratt drained only minimal serosanguineous drainage . Her chest x-ray obtained postoperatively was clear with no evidence of pneumothorax . She was given a morphine PCA and perioperative Ancef . Bedrest as instituted until 24 hours after the procedure . The patient was placed on a cardiac monitor . On the morning of the first postoperative day , the patient 's only complaint was of insomnia . She was afebrile and her vital signs were stable . Her urine output was adequate . Her abdomen was soft , nontender , nondistended . Bedrest continued until that afternoon when she got out of bed and did well . She had no further complaints , but did have temperature of about 101 degrees at around 3 in the afternoon . She defervesced gradually over the course of the afternoon with pulmonary toilet and ambulation . She had good oral intake that night . Her Foley catheter was removed , she voided spontaneously . By the morning of the second postoperative day , the patient was still without complaint and was anxious to go home . She was afebrile , her vital signs were stable , urine output was adequate , her Jackson-Pratt drainage was minimal and her exam was benign . The patient was felt to be stable enough for discharge at this time . DISCHARGE CONDITION : Stable . DISCHARGE ORDERS : The patient was instructed to continue with a liquid diet for the next two to three days until normal bowel function returns . She will report any signs of infection at the incision , any fevers , vomiting , urinary retention , abdominal distention or other complaints to Dr. Gardner 's office or to the emergency room . She was given prescriptions for the Percocet 5 and 325 one to two tabs p.o. q.3-4h. as needed for pain and Colace 100 mg p.o. t.i.d. Other medications on discharge will include Zestril 10 mg p.o. daily , Celexa 10 mg p.o. q.h.s. and Mirapex 0.25 mg p.o. q.h.s. The patient will call Dr. Gardner 's office to arrange a follow-up appointment . CHRETTA N GARDNER , M.D. DICTATING FOR : Electronically Signed ERIN TISIAKI GARDNER , M.D. 03/05/2005 15:58 _____________________________ ERIN TISIAKI GARDNER , M.D. TR : xz DD : 02/27/2005 TD : 02/28/2005 2:42 P 343705 cc : ERIN TISIAKI GARDNER , M.D. [ report_end ]
